line: that he is?

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: I would the cutting of my garments would serve the

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: turn, or the breaking of my Spanish sword.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: We cannot afford you so.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Or the baring of my beard; and to say it was in

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: stratagem.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: 'Twould not do.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Or to drown my clothes, and say I was stripped.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Hardly serve.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Though I swore I leaped from the window of the citadel.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: How deep?

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Thirty fathom.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Three great oaths would scarce make that be believed.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: I would I had any drum of the enemy's: I would swear

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: I recovered it.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: You shall hear one anon.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: A drum now of the enemy's,--

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Throca movousus, cargo, cargo, cargo.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: All
line: Cargo, cargo, cargo, villiando par corbo, cargo.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: O, ransom, ransom! do not hide mine eyes.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: Boskos thromuldo boskos.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: I know you are the Muskos' regiment:

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: And I shall lose my life for want of language;

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: If there be here German, or Dane, low Dutch,

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Italian, or French, let him speak to me; I'll

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Discover that which shall undo the Florentine.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: Boskos vauvado: I understand thee, and can speak

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: thy tongue. Kerely bonto, sir, betake thee to thy

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: faith, for seventeen poniards are at thy bosom.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: O!

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: O, pray, pray, pray! Manka revania dulche.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Oscorbidulchos volivorco.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: The general is content to spare thee yet;

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: And, hoodwink'd as thou art, will lead thee on

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: To gather from thee: haply thou mayst inform

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: Something to save thy life.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: O, let me live!

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: And all the secrets of our camp I'll show,

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Their force, their purposes; nay, I'll speak that

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: Which you will wonder at.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: But wilt thou faithfully?

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: PAROLLES
line: If I do not, damn me.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: Acordo linta.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: First Soldier
line: Come on; thou art granted space.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Go, tell the Count Rousillon, and my brother,

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: We have caught the woodcock, and will keep him muffled

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Till we do hear from them.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Soldier
line: Captain, I will.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: A' will betray us all unto ourselves:

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Inform on that.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Soldier
line: So I will, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  Without the Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Till then I'll keep him dark and safely lock'd.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: They told me that your name was Fontibell.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: No, my good lord, Diana.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Titled goddess;

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: And worth it, with addition! But, fair soul,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: In your fine frame hath love no quality?

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: If quick fire of youth light not your mind,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: You are no maiden, but a monument:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: When you are dead, you should be such a one

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: As you are now, for you are cold and stem;

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: And now you should be as your mother was

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: When your sweet self was got.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: She then was honest.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: So should you be.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: No:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: My mother did but duty; such, my lord,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: As you owe to your wife.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: No more o' that;

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: I prithee, do not strive against my vows:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: I was compell'd to her; but I love thee

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: By love's own sweet constraint, and will for ever

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Do thee all rights of service.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Ay, so you serve us

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Till we serve you; but when you have our roses,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: You barely leave our thorns to prick ourselves

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: And mock us with our bareness.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: How have I sworn!

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: 'Tis not the many oaths that makes the truth,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: But the plain single vow that is vow'd true.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: What is not holy, that we swear not by,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: But take the High'st to witness: then, pray you, tell me,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: If I should swear by God's great attributes,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: I loved you dearly, would you believe my oaths,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: When I did love you ill? This has no holding,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: To swear by him whom I protest to love,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: That I will work against him: therefore your oaths

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Are words and poor conditions, but unseal'd,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: At least in my opinion.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Change it, change it;

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Be not so holy-cruel: love is holy;

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: And my integrity ne'er knew the crafts

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: That you do charge men with. Stand no more off,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: But give thyself unto my sick desires,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Who then recover: say thou art mine, and ever

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: My love as it begins shall so persever.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: I see that men make ropes in such a scarre

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: That we'll forsake ourselves. Give me that ring.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: I'll lend it thee, my dear; but have no power

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: To give it from me.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Will you not, my lord?

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: It is an honour 'longing to our house,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Bequeathed down from many ancestors;

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Which were the greatest obloquy i' the world

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: In me to lose.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Mine honour's such a ring:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: My chastity's the jewel of our house,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Bequeathed down from many ancestors;

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Which were the greatest obloquy i' the world

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: In me to lose: thus your own proper wisdom

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Brings in the champion Honour on my part,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Against your vain assault.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: Here, take my ring:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: My house, mine honour, yea, my life, be thine,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: And I'll be bid by thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: When midnight comes, knock at my chamber-window:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: I'll order take my mother shall not hear.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Now will I charge you in the band of truth,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: When you have conquer'd my yet maiden bed,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Remain there but an hour, nor speak to me:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: My reasons are most strong; and you shall know them

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: When back again this ring shall be deliver'd:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: And on your finger in the night I'll put

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Another ring, that what in time proceeds

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: May token to the future our past deeds.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Adieu, till then; then, fail not. You have won

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: A wife of me, though there my hope be done.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: A heaven on earth I have won by wooing thee.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: For which live long to thank both heaven and me!

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: You may so in the end.

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: My mother told me just how he would woo,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: As if she sat in 's heart; she says all men

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Have the like oaths: he had sworn to marry me

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: When his wife's dead; therefore I'll lie with him

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: When I am buried. Since Frenchmen are so braid,

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Marry that will, I live and die a maid:

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: Only in this disguise I think't no sin

scene: SCENE II.  Florence. The Widow's house.
speaker: DIANA
line: To cozen him that would unjustly win.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: You have not given him his mother's letter?

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: I have delivered it an hour since: there is

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: something in't that stings his nature; for on the

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: reading it he changed almost into another man.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: He has much worthy blame laid upon him for shaking

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: off so good a wife and so sweet a lady.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Especially he hath incurred the everlasting

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: displeasure of the king, who had even tuned his

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: bounty to sing happiness to him. I will tell you a

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: thing, but you shall let it dwell darkly with you.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: When you have spoken it, 'tis dead, and I am the

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: grave of it.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: He hath perverted a young gentlewoman here in

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Florence, of a most chaste renown; and this night he

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: fleshes his will in the spoil of her honour: he hath

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: given her his monumental ring, and thinks himself

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: made in the unchaste composition.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: Now, God delay our rebellion! as we are ourselves,

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: what things are we!

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Merely our own traitors. And as in the common course

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: of all treasons, we still see them reveal

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: themselves, till they attain to their abhorred ends,

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: so he that in this action contrives against his own

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: nobility, in his proper stream o'erflows himself.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: Is it not meant damnable in us, to be trumpeters of

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: our unlawful intents? We shall not then have his

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: company to-night?

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Not till after midnight; for he is dieted to his hour.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: That approaches apace; I would gladly have him see

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: his company anatomized, that he might take a measure

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: of his own judgments, wherein so curiously he had

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: set this counterfeit.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: We will not meddle with him till he come; for his

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: presence must be the whip of the other.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: In the mean time, what hear you of these wars?

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: I hear there is an overture of peace.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: Nay, I assure you, a peace concluded.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: What will Count Rousillon do then? will he travel

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: higher, or return again into France?

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: I perceive, by this demand, you are not altogether

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: of his council.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Let it be forbid, sir; so should I be a great deal

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: of his act.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: Sir, his wife some two months since fled from his

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: house: her pretence is a pilgrimage to Saint Jaques

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: le Grand; which holy undertaking with most austere

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: sanctimony she accomplished; and, there residing the

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: tenderness of her nature became as a prey to her

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: grief; in fine, made a groan of her last breath, and

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: now she sings in heaven.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: How is this justified?

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: The stronger part of it by her own letters, which

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: makes her story true, even to the point of her

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: death: her death itself, which could not be her

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: office to say is come, was faithfully confirmed by

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: the rector of the place.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: Hath the count all this intelligence?

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: Ay, and the particular confirmations, point from

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: point, so to the full arming of the verity.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: I am heartily sorry that he'll be glad of this.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: How mightily sometimes we make us comforts of our losses!

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: And how mightily some other times we drown our gain

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: in tears! The great dignity that his valour hath

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: here acquired for him shall at home be encountered

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: with a shame as ample.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: The web of our life is of a mingled yarn, good and

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: ill together: our virtues would be proud, if our

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: faults whipped them not; and our crimes would

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: despair, if they were not cherished by our virtues.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: First Lord
line: How now! where's your master?

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Servant
line: He met the duke in the street, sir, of whom he hath

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Servant
line: taken a solemn leave: his lordship will next

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Servant
line: morning for France. The duke hath offered him

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Servant
line: letters of commendations to the king.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: They shall be no more than needful there, if they

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.
speaker: Second Lord
line: were more than they can commend.

scene: SCENE III.  The Florentine camp.

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: HELENA
line: 'When from my finger you can get this ring

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: HELENA
line: And are by me with child,' &c. This is done:

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: HELENA
line: Will you be mine, now you are doubly won?

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: If she, my liege, can make me know this clearly,

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: BERTRAM
line: I'll love her dearly, ever, ever dearly.

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: HELENA
line: If it appear not plain and prove untrue,

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: HELENA
line: Deadly divorce step between me and you!

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: HELENA
line: O my dear mother, do I see you living?

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: LAFEU
line: Mine eyes smell onions; I shall weep anon:

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: LAFEU
line: Good Tom Drum, lend me a handkercher: so,

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: LAFEU
line: I thank thee: wait on me home, I'll make sport with thee:

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: LAFEU
line: Let thy courtesies alone, they are scurvy ones.

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: Let us from point to point this story know,

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: To make the even truth in pleasure flow.

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: If thou be'st yet a fresh uncropped flower,

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: Choose thou thy husband, and I'll pay thy dower;

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: For I can guess that by thy honest aid

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: Thou keep'st a wife herself, thyself a maid.

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: Of that and all the progress, more or less,

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: Resolvedly more leisure shall express:

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: All yet seems well; and if it end so meet,

scene: SCENE III.  Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.
speaker: KING
line: The bitter past, more welcome is the sweet.
